result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jonathan G Vold was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.

AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
Enclosed is an assessment referral form.  To set up an appointment, call the number on the referral form.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonathan G Vold in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Raymond recites agreement.  State moves to amend Count 1 to reflect a 5th Offense OWI - Court grants amendment.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1 OWI 5th Offense.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Counts 2, 3 and 4 are Dismissed.  State and Defense stipulate to waive PSI.  Court waives PSI.  State relates.  Attorney Raymond relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

.216 BAC

SW - 3 years Probation
$600 fine plus costs
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample
Must maintain absolute sobriety
9 months jail as condition of Probation - Good time granted - Huber for work release granted - Sentence may be served in Chippewa County if at no cost to Barron County - Sentence to begin immediately
2 year DL Revocation
2 year Ignition Interlock effective today
2 days jail credit if Probation is revoked

Firearm and voting rights warning given.  Copy of minutes given to Defendant.  Jail faxed.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.  
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is served or sold.  
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license or permit.
Must submit to daily PBTs at the Eau Claire City Police Department or Eau Claire County Sheriff's Department.

02/03/2016:  Court deletes daily PBT condition and adds the condition that defendant must complete an AODA in Eau Claire County within 30 days and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.  Proof to be provided to the Clerk of Courts office.

Defendant Jonathan G Vold in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court grants bond modification to delete the daily PBT condition and add the condition must complete an AODA in Eau Claire County within 30 days and comply with recommended follow-up treatment be added. Documentation of same is to be provided to the Clerk of Courts Office. 

State requests to reschedule the preliminary hearing. Time limits waived by Defense. Reset.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
